data.title: AISES Scholarships
data.meta_description: Financial aid for Indigenous students in STEM through scholarships funded by dedicated AISES donors and partners.
data.text:
Previous travel scholarship recipients are not eligible.

Award: Covers the cost of AISES National Conference registration fees, economy class round-trip airfare, and lodging (a same-gender roommate will be assigned)

GPA: 3.0 or higher

Eligible Fields of Study: Any STEM field

Conditions:

Must attend the entire conference

Must abide by the AISES Code of Conduct

Recipient must cover ground transportation, baggage fees, meals, parking, and incidental expenses (Some conference meals will be provided as part of the registration)

Application Requirements:

Completed application

Completed Travel Scholarship Essay

1 letter of recommendation

A current resume

Verification of current school enrollment and standing

Undergraduate transcripts and/or graduate transcripts (unofficial accepted)

Selection Criteria: Applicants will be reviewed on the quality of their essay and explanations of why and how attending the AISES National Conference will benefit them, the letters of recommendation, the student’s involvement with AISES, and the strength of their GPA.

Travel scholarship recipients will be contacted by August 9.

Application Deadline: July 31

About

If you are an American Indian, Alaska Native, Native Hawaiian, Pacific Islander, or an Indigenous person from Canada and are pursuing STEM education, the AISES National Conference is the place to be! Attendance will allow students to explore the role of STEM in meeting the challenges of a global society and expand the experience and leadership opportunities of young professionals in STEM. Students will meet researchers, practitioners, and leaders currently engaged in STEM studies and careers. The AISES Conference will have over 80 sessions to choose from. Travel scholarship recipients will have the opportunity to engage in cross-cultural dialogues to share knowledge and network with STEM professionals from North America.

Learn more about the conference at conference.aises.org.

Award Amount: $2,500 per academic year for four years (for a maximum of 8 semesters) or until baccalaureate degree is obtained, whichever occurs first

Eligible Student Level: High school seniors

GPA Requirement: 3.0 or higher

Location: Student must reside in one of the 23 states serviced by the BNSF Pacific Corporation and its affiliated companies: Arizona, California, Colorado, Kansas, Minnesota, Montana, New Mexico, North Dakota, Oklahoma, Oregon, South Dakota, Texas, Washington, Arkansas, Louisiana, Utah, Nevada, Wyoming, Illinois, Missouri, Nebraska, Wisconsin, or Iowa.

Eligible Fields of Study: Business, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Technology, Supply Chain, Information Systems, Communications, Computer and Information Sciences, Construction Management, Construction Trades, Marketing, Engineering, Industrial Engineering, and Agriculture

Award Amount: $5,000 per academic year. Students with dependent children will also receive preference and may be eligible for additional financial support for childcare via SPEEA-ACE program of up to $5,000

Eligibility: Student must be enrolled in Washington State’s public higher education systems at the undergraduate or graduate level

Preference: Veterans and active-duty military spouses’ students will be offered preference

GPA: 3.0 or higher

Eligible Fields of Study: engineering or other high-demand degree that supports professional and technical careers in the aerospace industry.

The program will provide three students with a $20,000 scholarship during the 2024-2026 academic years.

Award Amount: $6,500 annually for up to two years distributed in two installments each year (fall and spring term) and $7,000 allotment for mechanical tools

GPA: 2.5 or higher

Eligibility: Accepted into a college with a Mopar CAP or Mopar CAP local curriculum
